On Wed, 2004-03-10 at 21:28, haefeleuser wrote:
> Maybe some people he=
re remember my discussion a year ago. I don't 
> know what my nick name was=
. But my first topic was a discussion 
> about the value of JUnit compared =
to Design by Contract.
> 
> It was very controversial. At times I asked mys=
elf, if I was right 
> when many gurus here were arguing against my opinion=
. I will not 
> repeat the discussion.
> 
> But I have seen that the DBC in=
ventor himself seems to support my 
> opinion recently: http://www.artima.c=
om/intv/contestP.html
> 
> I have only read the summary until now. Maybe yo=
u are interested in 
> what he has to say in favor of Contract-Driven Devel=
opment. I like 
> the idea of Design by Contract. And I think that it could=
 make 
> traditional JUnit tests obsolete, since the test cases could 
> au=
tomatically be generated from the Contracts. I think this is what 
> Paraso=
ft JTest already does.
> 
> Don't misunderstand me. I like JUnit. But I alw=
ays look for better 
> ways to solve my problems. So I hope you are as open=
 as me to new 
> solutions and ideas.

I will say only this: if by any reas=
on you find that DBC suits your
preferences/needs better than unit testing =
use it.  But in trying to
convince a TDD person of it I believe you would b=
e wasting your time.  I
don't think, for instance, that DBC would have solv=
ed the recent issues
with the Mars rovers.
